meanings.definition: To outsmart or outmaneuver in political strategy.
meanings.sent1: She managed to outpolitick her opponent in the election.
meanings.sent2: The candidate was able to outpolitick his rivals with his clever tactics.
meanings.sent3: The mayor's ability to outpolitick his opponents made him a formidable force in the city council.
meanings.sent4: In the game of politics, it's crucial to outpolitick your adversaries to succeed.
meanings.sent5: Her talent to outpolitick others was unmatched and admired by many.

meanings.definition: To surpass in political cunning or skill.
meanings.sent1: He always tries to outpolitick his colleagues in the office.
meanings.sent2: The senator was known for his ability to outpolitick even the most experienced politicians.
meanings.sent3: The student council president managed to outpolitick his classmates in the election.
meanings.sent4: She outpoliticked everyone in the debate with her sharp arguments.
meanings.sent5: The diplomat's skill to outpolitick his opponents was legendary in international relations.
